description: Borrowed from Latin dēmonstrō, dēmonstrātus (“I show”).

verbs.description: demonstrate (third-person singular simple present demonstrates, present participle demonstrating, simple past and past participle demonstrated)

examples: Can you demonstrate the new tools for us?

entries.meaning: to show the steps taken to create a logical argument or equation.
(intransitive) to participate in or organize a demonstration.
examples: Those people outside are demonstrating against the election results.

entries.meaning: (transitive) to show, display, or present; to prove or make evident
